company_profile: Hanoi-based Military Commercial Joint Stock Bank (MBB) was established in 1994 with an inital objective to support military companies in business activities. The Bank has its business in banking services, financial services, fund management, asset management, and real estate. In addition to the traditional market, the Bank has already developed an diversified the types of financial products and services to meet demands of others clients. In 2023, In 2024, compared to the same period, the net interest margin (NIM) stood at 4.07%, reflecting a decrease of 0.71%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 1.62%, increasing of 0.02%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 92.25%, decreasing of 24.73%. The net profit after tax of parent company is valued at VND22.6 trillion, increased 9.46%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 22.09%, down 2.42%. MBB has listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE) since 2001.
history_dev: 04 November 1994: Military Commercial Joint Stock Bank was established with a charter capital of VND20 billion. 2000: MB founded 2 subsidiaries: Thang Long Securities company Limited,(Thang LongSecurities Joint Stock company now) and MB Assets Management Company Limited. 2004: MB was the first bank to have issued stocks through auction with a total par value of VND20billion. The lender also issued active Plus debit cards. 2006: MB Fund Management Stock Company was established. 2007: MB issued 1VND trillion worth of convertible bonds, 2-year term. 2009: MB raised its chartered capital to VND 5,300 billion. 2010: MB opened its overseas branch in Laos. It raised charter capital and total assets to VND7.3 trillion and VND106.6 trillion, respectively. 2011: MB was listed on HOSE with the stock code MBB. 2011: MB opened its second overseas branch in Cambodia 2013: Increased the charter capital to VND11,256.25 billion.  August 31, 2017: Increased the charter capital to VND18,155,053,630,000; July 31, 2018: Increased the charter capital to VND21,604,513,810,000; December 05, 2019: Increased the charter capital to VND23,727,322,800,000; March 31, 2020: Increased the charter capital to VND24,370,428,610,000; November 18, 2020: Increased charter capital to VND27,987,568,720,000. August 10, 2021: Increased charter capital to VND37,783,217,770,000; October 20, 2022:  Increased charter capital to VND45,339,861,330,000; August 11, 2023: Increased charter capital to VND52,140,840,520,000; May 16, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND52,870,840,520,000; November 25, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND53,063,240,520,000; February 14, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND61,022,726,590,000; September 24, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND80,549,999,090,000;
key_developments: Banking services: fund mobilization, lending; card and money transfer services, and guarantees,  derivative products. Investment services: securities investment and real estate. Assets Management: investment funds.
business_strategies: Increasing the percentage of revenue from retail banking services in the business structure; Promoting sales through the digital channels and cross-sale channels to take advantage of the distribution network of strategic partners and its members; Developing and applying a risk management framework to measure, monitor, mitigate and prevent risks in banking activities;
